title: Elementary student accidentally shot during altercation with officer
content:
Officers called to Henry David Thoreau School at about 1 p.m.
MILWAUKEE —
A Milwaukee student was injured Thursday when an officer's gun fired while still in the holster, a police spokesman said.
Officers were called to Henry David Thoreau School, on the 7800 block of North 60th Street, near West Bradley Avenue, at around 1 p.m.
Police said a 13-year-old girl became combative with officers during an investigation. An officer's gun went off while police tried to control the student, the spokesman said.
The student suffered a graze wound and was transported to a local hospital.
